Feb 1 - 3i Infrastructure has added a £400m one-year loan to take its debt pile to £1bn from its lenders. The company has a £400m three-year revolving credit facility in place with two one-year extension options, priced at 150bp over Sonia, with a £200m accordion option. The funding banks are Barclays, ICBC, Lloyds, NatWest, NAB, RBC, SEB and SMBC. Before year-end the company agreed acquisitions totalling £850m in Global Cloud Xchange, Esvagt, SRL Traffic Systems and Valorem. SRL will be the first of the three deals to complete and it is expected when they all complete in mid-year, 3i Infra will have drawn down £550m of the debt. 

(Reporting by Rod Morrison)
